pesticide.PPE: WPS USES: Applicators and Other Handlers who handle this product for any use covered by the Worker Protection Standard (40 CFR part 170) – in general, agricultural plant uses e.g., use in sod farms, must wear: Long-sleeved shirt and long pants; Chemical resistant gloves made of any waterproof material such as barrier laminate, butyl rubber, nitrile rubber, neoprene rubber, natural rubber, polyethylene, polyvinylchloride (PVC) or viton; If you want more options, follow the instructions for category A on an EPA chemical-resistance category selection chart; Shoes plus socks; Follow manufacturer’s instructions for cleaning/ maintaining PPE; If no such instructions for washables, use detergent and hot water; Keep and wash PPE separately from other laundry. Non-WPS USES: Applicators and other handlers who handle this product for any use NOT covered by the Worker Protection Standard (40 CFR part 170) – in general, only agricultural plant uses are covered by the WPS, must wear: Shirt and pants; Gloves; Shoes plus socks.
pesticide.trade_Name: Shaw’s® Turf Food with Grub Control 20 Merit®

Safety_Information.general_Info: Have the product container or label with you when calling a poison control center or doctor, or going for treatment.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: No specific antidote is available. Treat the patient symptomatically.
